oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tribute - Audio architects of the Nashville Sound: Audio Engineering Society Lifetime Achievement Awards - 2018-07-01
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Nashville chapter of the Audio Engineering Society pays tribute with the Lifetime Achievement awards to live sound engineer Richard Hargett, technical engineer Claude Hill, mastering engineer George Ingram, live recording engineer Johnny Rosen, and technical engineer Tom Sparkman from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on July 1, 2018. Includes selected recorded excerpts and audio from video. Master of Ceremonies is Mike Porter.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: MIke Porter; Richard "Dick" Hargett; Johnny Rosen; George Ingram; Tom Sparkman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (11:21) Opening comments by Ali Tonn / (13:10) Introduction of AES Nashville chairman Barry Cardineal / (13:24) Barry's opening comments and explanation of awards / (17:05) Barry introduces Mike Porter / (17:29) Mike's opening comments / (19:35) Johnny Rosen segment begins with video presentation of Rosen talking about his career / (29:58) Mike introduces Danny Wendell to speak about Johnny Rosen / (30:13) Danny with remarks about Rosen / (32:14) Video presentation of the 1987 PBS TV Special Chet Atkins and Friends featuring Michael McDonald's performance of I Keep Forgettin’ (Every Time You’re Near) / (36:07) Wendell speaks more about Rosen and congratulates him / (36:48) Mike Porter reads award text along with presentation of award to Johnny / (37:25) Rosen with acceptance remarks / (40:33) Mike with final Rosen presentation comments / (40:57) Mike begins Richard "Dick" Hargett segment / (41:52) Audio of morse code message / (42:23) Continues with Hargett segment / (43:23) Audio segments from Flatt and Scruggs radio show and the Waking Crew with Teddy Bart / (44:38) Audio from Ernest Tubb show opening / (45:37) Video presentation with comments about Hargett by Jim Gilmore and one other unidentified engineer / () Introduction of Faye Hargett and family with presentation of award / (48:40) Faye Hargett acceptance remarks / (49:00) George Ingram segment remarks by Mike Porter / (50:40) Video presentation with Ingram talking about his career and others talking about him / (55:19) During the video presentation, George talks about the Third Man Records lathe, the Third Man Records Lazaretto album project / (59:28) Talks about Vortex Records etched recordings / (01:01:22) Ingram presentation continues with Wes Garland segment / () Final thoughts on video from George / (01:06:06) Mike introduces Elaine Ingram to the front along with George / (01:06:56) George Ingram award acceptance remarks / (01:08:25) Claude Hill segment remarks by Mike Porter / (01:09:22) Claude Hill video interview segment begins / (01:25:10) Claude Hill with award acceptance remarks / (01:36:08) Mike Porter begins Tom Sparkman segment / (01:38:02) Video interview segment begins / (01:50:35) Tom Sparkman family accepts award for him (some off-mic comments) / (01:52:00) Mike Porter with closing comments and program acknowledgements / (01:54:18) Final comments by Barry Cardineal / (01:55:26) Walk-out music / (01:56:38) FILE END
